result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Jerard Smith

records.addlTxt:
ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD.
Scheduling Conference rescheduled to November 14, 2022 at 8:30am.

2:48 PM Defendant Michael Jerard Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt appeared by video for Michael Jerard Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 19, Judge K. Ashley. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 8:30am.

Defendant Michael Jerard Smith not in court, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt appeared by video for Michael Jerard Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defendant unable to appear by video from MSDF. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status Conference.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Jerard Smith not in court, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt appeared by video for Michael Jerard Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel requests an adjournment. Needs time to meet with defendant. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Conference.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Michael Jerard Smith appeared by video, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt appeared by video for Michael Jerard Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defendant requests a Waiver of the Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel is unable to produce the Waiver form due to computer issues. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Time of the next court date has changed from 10am to 11am due to the availability of MSDF to connect the defendant by video. Parties have been notified.
Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Angela M.D.-A.; Jackeline A.; Achar K.; & Tamara M.L.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $15,000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael Jerard Smith appeared by video, in custody at MSDF.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt appeared by video for Michael Jerard Smith.  Attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. AS TO COUNT 1: Court amends "use of dangerous weapon" enhancer from 939.63(1)(a) to 939.63(1)(b)   Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed by Attorney Mark Schoenfeldt

Adjustment Number: 22A 075048,
Payable Number: 1024292,
Receipt Number: 22RP031460,
Amount: $20.00
